_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

This Sunday morning, we wake up under a light blanket of fresh snow: 3 cm fell over the past 24 hours, providing a welcome refresh to surface conditions. Just enough to soften the trails and remind us that winter is very much here.

Today, the Porte du Soleil lift is open, giving access to additional terrain, while the bottom of Chalumeau remains closed for now. Our goal remains to open as many runs as possible as quickly as we can! On that note, few additional trails will be opening progressively throughout the day! A big thank-you to our grooming team, who worked through the night to prepare a high-quality network of trails and provide optimal surfaces for skiers and snowboarders.

The Mitik and Progression parks are also open, benefiting fully from the fresh snow and ongoing maintenance. If you had a few park laps on your agenda, today is the perfect day to enjoy them!

Finally, strong winds are expected throughout the day, especially at higher elevations. Dress warmly and adjust your skiing to the conditions, which may vary from trail to trail. Conditions can change quickly, so we encourage you to check this page regularly for the latest updates.

We look forward to welcoming you to the summit!

Mountain safety tip of the week: KNOW THE ZONE. On the slopes, leave enough space to avoid collisions. Control your speed and direction to maintain a safe distance from others, in case they suddenly change direction.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Sunday morning, 3 cm of fresh snow has fallen, giving the trails a welcome refresh. The Porte du Soleil lift is open, while the bottom of Chalumeau remains closed. Mitik and Progression parks are in good shape and ready to be used. We also have 3 alpine touring trails open! Finally, strong winds are expected all day, especially at higher elevations, so dress warmly and ski cautiously.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce dimanche matin, 3 cm de nouvelle neige sont tombés, offrant un léger coup de frais aux pistes. La remontée Porte du Soleil est ouverte, tandis que le bas de Chalumeau reste fermé. Les parcs Mitik et Progression sont en bonne condition et prêts à être utilisés. Nous avons également 3 sentiers de ski de randonnée alpine ouverts ! Enfin, des vents forts sont prévus toute la journée, surtout en altitude, alors habillez-vous chaudement et skiez prudemment.
